ngiemboon: N dɔɔn ńzsé léshwóŋo meshwóŋè mie mé shwóŋo tsɛ̀ɛ mengwòŋ ntsèm, tà mbɔɔ mie mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé shwóŋo, tá ḿbiŋ te kwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́, mbà m bege pɔ́ jʉʼ páʼ mmó tʉ̌ gie mé pǔʼ, mbɔɔ páʼ kẅíʼfùɔ gẅie à zẅɛ zẅɛ.
en: If I speak human or angelic tongues   but do not have love,  # 13:1 Jn 13:35; 1Jn 4:7–12 I am a noisy gong  # 13:1 Mt 10:9 or a clanging cymbal.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ngwɔ́ e Ssé cÿó gʉm yɔ́ɔn n tsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwó yé, ńzsé nò na kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa lelyěen, ḿbiŋ ńzsé nò na shúm ntsèm. À lɔɔn ngwɔ́ n záb ntʉ́m wɔ́ɔn na Ssé, tà ńkuʼu légÿo mekwɛ́ sẅɛ́ʼte nnɛ́, tá ńké ńgwɔ́ gie n dɔɔn te kwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́, mbà n te tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: If I have the gift of prophecy   and understand all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have all faith so that I can move mountains  # 13:2 Mt 17:20 but do not have love, I am nothing.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ngwɔ́ n gabte shúm sɔ́ɔn ntsèm ńnáa mbwó pʉ̀a pie nzyè ne ńgyáŋa wɔ́b, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n zẅíŋ ngie mé tuɔ wɔ́ɔn, tá á gwaa gwɔ́ púʼu, n te kwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́, mbà á té kẅéte wɔ́ɔn na tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: And if I give away all my possessions, and if I give over my body in order to boast   but do not have love, I gain nothing.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à kwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ, à gẅiin kwɔ̀gɔnnɛ́, à kẅéte pʉ̀a, à te gẅiin kegɔ̀ʼ wɔ́, à te nyɛ nnɛ́ wɔ́, à te ŋáʼte,
en: Love is patient,   love is kind. Love does not envy,  # 13:4 Nm 25:13; Gl 4:17 is not boastful, is not arrogant,  # 13:4 1Co 4:6

ngiemboon: à te gÿo menò shʉ́ wɔ́, à te kim, à te lwo ńgyáŋa lóŋ wɔ́, à te gẅiin nyìŋ lóŋ yé wɔ́,
en: is not rude, is not self-seeking,   is not irritable,  # 13:5 Ac 17:16 and does not keep a record of wrongs.

ngiemboon: à te kága na cÿɔ̌nò wɔ́, à kǎg yé pɔ́ na nò nénʉ́.
en: Love finds no joy in unrighteousness but rejoices in the truth.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à kwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ, nyìŋ fʉa pɔ́ yɛ̌ nò mbwó yé wɔ́ɔ, á lege lege, á gʉa na kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ, á záb ntʉ́m wé pɔ́ na Ssé, ńnéŋe ńne ńzẅíʼte yé pɔ́ ngie akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ ge gÿo maʼa twó pɔ́ mboŋó, à gyá ngɔ́ʼ lêkɔ́ wɔ́ɔ, ńkwé pɔ́ ntsème tsème.
en: It bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures   all things.

ngiemboon: Enkwòŋe gie nyìŋ mesoŋ gẅiin nzèm wetsɔ̌, e ge láʼa gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó. Tá á gʉa na páʼ e Ssé cÿó gʉme pʉ̀a, pɔ́ tsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwó yé, wɛ̌ le gwɔ́ à mag, leshwoŋó meshwóŋè mie mé laa zíʼi à mag yé, lezsé mmó gie áa lelyěen á le gíŋ ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́,
en: Love never ends.   But as for prophecies, they will come to an end; as for tongues, they will cease; as for knowledge, it will come to an end.

ngiemboon: á nue pege ee fʉ̀ʼɔɔn ńzsé pɔ́ tsɔ́ gwǒŋ, e Ssé te nyɛɛ wégè shúm ntsèm tá pege tsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwó yé wɔ́.
en: For we know in part, and we prophesy in part,

ngiemboon: À ge ké láʼ gwɔ́ tà nyɛɛ wégè shúm ntsèm, múɔ mézsénò we fʉ̀ʼɔɔn mag.
en: but when the perfect comes, the partial will come to an end.

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀ʼ gie n da nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ múɔ mémúɔ, éshwóŋo páʼ múɔ mémúɔ, ńkwaŋa nò páʼ múɔ mémúɔ, ésáŋa nò páʼ múɔ mémúɔ. M biŋ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn gie n cʉ̌ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndÿò, n te gíŋ ńne ńgÿo menò páʼ múɔ mémúɔ wɔ́.
en: When I was a child, I spoke like a child, I thought like a child, I reasoned like a child. When I became a man, I put aside childish things.

ngiemboon: Áa fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, pege ne ńgyá shúm é tele tele pɔ́ páʼ fʉ̀ʼ gie pege gyá tsɛ̀ɛ nzẅìŋe gyàshÿó la. Á ge láʼa tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ, pege kwàʼ ńgyá, e gwɔ́ fʉʼó ńgwɔ́ mvfò pege, áa na fʉ̀ʼɔɔn n te zsé shúm ntsèm wɔ́, táʼ, n ge láʼa tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ é zsé shúm na ntí gie e Ssé ne ńzsé wɔ́ɔn fʉ̀ʼɔɔn púʼu.
en: For now we see only a reflection   as in a mirror, but then face to face.  # 13:12 1Jn 3:2 Now I know in part, but then I will know fully,  # 13:12 Pr 2:6; Jn 17:3; 1Jn 4:8 as I am fully known.  # 13:12 1Co 8:3; Gl 4:9

ngiemboon: Pege lɔgɔ páʼɔɔn ńgyá ngie eshúm sie é ge láʼa gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, ée sétá: Wɔɔn aa lezǎb ntʉ́m na Ssé, wɔɔn gwɔ́ lénéŋe ńne ńzẅíʼte mmó mbwó Ssé, ńgÿo lékwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ. Táʼ, atwó yelÿò na shúm sɔɔn sétá, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ lékwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ.
en: Now these three remain: faith, hope,   and love #— #but the greatest of these is love.
